edu.ncsu.csc.cucumber

Class InventoryStepDefs

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.cucumber.InventoryStepDefs

  • public class InventoryStepDefs
extends java.lang.Object
    StepDefs (Cucumber) test class for interacting with the Inventory model. This performs a number of tests to ensure that the inventory is changed in the expected manner
    Author:
    Kai Presler-Marshall, Sarah Elder

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      InventoryStepDefs(SharedInventoryData sid)

      Ensure that an error was thrown while attempting to perform an action
      void initialInventory(int originalCoffee, int originalMilk, int originalSugar, int originalChocolate)
      This Cucumber "Given" step ensures that the Recipe has the amount of ingredients specified.

      Add the specified amount of ingredients to the CoffeeMaker's inventory.
      void inventoryAdded()
      Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory has been updated and that it stores the values in the SharedInventoryData
      void inventoryNotUpdated()
      Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory was not updated and contains the same values that were already stored in the "backup" Shared Inventory Data.
      void inventoryUpdated()
      Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory has been updated and that it stores the values in the SharedInventoryData
      void removeInventoryHelper(int removeCoffee, int removeMilk, int removeSugar, int removeChocolate)
      The CoffeeMaker has no (direct) way to remove ingredients from the Inventory it stores, this allows us to effectively do so by creating a recipe with the amount of ingredients to remove, and then making coffee with the Recipe just created

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventoryStepDefs

        public InventoryStepDefs(SharedInventoryData sid)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        sid - SharedInventoryData; basically a backup copy of the inventory to make sure that changes made to the "real" one are what is expected

    • Method Detail

      • removeInventoryHelper

        public void removeInventoryHelper(int removeCoffee,
                                  int removeMilk,
                                  int removeSugar,
                                  int removeChocolate)
        The CoffeeMaker has no (direct) way to remove ingredients from the Inventory it stores, this allows us to effectively do so by creating a recipe with the amount of ingredients to remove, and then making coffee with the Recipe just created
        Parameters:
        removeCoffee - Amount of Coffee to remove from the Inventory
        removeMilk - Amount of Milk to remove from the Inventory
        removeSugar - Amount of Sugar to remove from the Inventory
        removeChocolate - Amount of Chocolate to remove from the Inventory

      • initialInventory

        @Given(value="^there is (-?\\d+) coffee, (-?\\d+) milk, (-?\\d+) sugar, and (-?\\d+) chocolate in the CoffeeMaker$")
public void initialInventory(int originalCoffee,
                                                                                                                                                   int originalMilk,
                                                                                                                                                   int originalSugar,
                                                                                                                                                   int originalChocolate)
        This Cucumber "Given" step ensures that the Recipe has the amount of ingredients specified. This is used to ensure that preconditions for the tests are satisfied
        Parameters:
        originalCoffee - Amount of Coffee that the inventory will be set to have
        originalMilk - Amount of Milk that the inventory will be set to have
        originalSugar - Amount of Sugar that the inventory will be set to have
        originalChocolate - Amount of Chocolate that the inventory will be set to have

      • addInventory

        @When(value="^I add (-?\\d+) coffee, (-?\\d+) milk, (-?\\d+) sugar, and (-?\\d+) chocolate$")
public void addInventory(int amtCoffee,
                                                                                                                        int amtMilk,
                                                                                                                        int amtSugar,
                                                                                                                        int amtChocolate)
        Add the specified amounts of ingredients to the CoffeeMaker's inventory. This is required to pass.
        Parameters:
        amtCoffee - Amount of Coffee to add to the Inventory.
        amtMilk - Amount of Milk to add to the Inventory.
        amtSugar - Amount of Sugar to add to the Inventory.
        amtChocolate - Amount of Chocolate to add to the Inventory.

      • invalidAddInventory

        @When(value="^I attempt to add (-?\\d+) coffee, (-?\\d+) milk, (-?\\d+) sugar, and (-?\\d+) chocolate$")
public void invalidAddInventory(int amtCoffee,
                                                                                                                                          int amtMilk,
                                                                                                                                          int amtSugar,
                                                                                                                                          int amtChocolate)
        Add the specified amount of ingredients to the CoffeeMaker's inventory. This is for testing with invalid values and is expected to fail.
        Parameters:
        amtCoffee - Amount of Coffee to add to the Inventory.
        amtMilk - Amount of Milk to add to the Inventory.
        amtSugar - Amount of Sugar to add to the Inventory.
        amtChocolate - Amount of Chocolate to add to the Inventory.

      • updateInventory

        @When(value="^I update it to be (-?\\d+) coffee, (-?\\d+) milk, (-?\\d+) sugar, and (-?\\d+) chocolate$")
public void updateInventory(int amtCoffee,
                                                                                                                                       int amtMilk,
                                                                                                                                       int amtSugar,
                                                                                                                                       int amtChocolate)
        Set the CoffeeMaker's Inventory to have the amount of ingredients specified. This will completely replace the values that were already stored.
        Parameters:
        amtCoffee - Amount of Coffee to set the inventory to contain.
        amtMilk - Amount of Milk to set the inventory to contain.
        amtSugar - Amount of Sugar to set the inventory to contain.
        amtChocolate - Amount of Chocolate to set the inventory to contain.

      • inventoryNotUpdated

        @Then(value="^the inventory of the CoffeeMaker is not updated$")
public void inventoryNotUpdated()
        Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory was not updated and contains the same values that were already stored in the "backup" Shared Inventory Data.

      • inventoryAdded

        @Then(value="^the inventory of the CoffeeMaker is successfully added$")
public void inventoryAdded()
        Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory has been updated and that it stores the values in the SharedInventoryData

      • inventoryUpdated

        @Then(value="^the inventory of the CoffeeMaker is successfully updated$")
public void inventoryUpdated()
        Verify that the CoffeeMaker's Inventory has been updated and that it stores the values in the SharedInventoryData

      • errorThrown

        @Then(value="^an error occurs for (.+)$")
public void errorThrown(java.lang.String error)
        Ensure that an error was thrown while attempting to perform an action
        Parameters:
        error - The error message to check
